meanings.sent1: The two countries decided to coannex their territories for better cooperation.
meanings.sent2: It is common for neighboring towns to coannex to improve services for residents.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces seemed to coannex magically, forming a complete picture.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity coannexed with her strong leadership qualities.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the rainbow beautifully coannex in the sky after a storm.

meanings.definition: To add or attach as an additional part
meanings.sent1: Please coannex the new document to the existing file for reference.
meanings.sent2: The architect plans to coannex a modern extension to the historic building.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally coannexed my shopping list to my work presentation - oops!
meanings.sent4: His witty remarks always coannex well with the overall tone of the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The fresh herbs coannex perfectly with the flavors of the dish, enhancing the taste.
